derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (in the sense 'follower, obsequious underling'): from French satellite or Latin satelles, satellit- 'attendant'

entry.def: A satellite is an object which has been sent into space in order to collect information or to be part of a communications system. Satellites move continually round the earth or around another planet.

example.ex: The rocket launched two communications satellites...
example.tran: 火箭发射了两颗通信卫星。

example.ex: The signals are sent by satellite link...
example.tran: 信号通过人造卫星链路发出。

entry.tran: (电视)使用卫星技术的;卫视的
entry.def: Satellite television is broadcast using a satellite.

example.tran: 他们有 4 个卫星频道。

entry.def: A satellite is a natural object in space that moves round a planet or star.

entry.tran: 卫星国;附属国;卫星区;卫星组织
entry.def: You can refer to a country, area, or organization as a satellite when it is controlled by or depends on a larger and more powerful one.

example.ex: Italy became a satellite state of Germany by the end of the 1930s.
example.tran: 意大利在 20 世纪 30 年代末成了德国的附庸。
俄国及其曾经的卫星国

means.word_mean: 1. man-made equipment that orbits around the earth or the moon
2. a person who follows or serves another
3. any celestial body orbiting around a planet or star
1. surrounding and dominated by a central authority or power;
